intro: Sclerocarpus exiguus, commonly known as the small-sclerocarpus, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a small, herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in spikes, and it is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves. Its fruit is a dry, indehiscent capsule that contains a single, hard-seeded kernel. Sclerocarpus exiguus is adapted to dry, well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed or rocky habitats.
